publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-284 Rhoda Grant: Dangers of Fireworks—That the Parliament notes the unsafe and aggressive use of fireworks by children, young people and adults; congratulates Inverness Family Project for its work in highlighting the dangers of fireworks; urges further action to reduce the dangers and problems of fireworks, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to set up a working party to examine the issue.
S1M-284 Dangers of Fireworks (lodged on 15 November 1999) Elaine Smith*

S1M-284 Rhoda Grant: Dangers of Fireworks—That the Parliament notes the unsafe and aggressive use of fireworks by children, young people and adults; congratulates Inverness Family Project for its work in highlighting the dangers of fireworks; urges further action to reduce the dangers and problems of fireworks, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to set up a working party to examine the issue. Supported by: Elaine Smith
S1M-284 Dangers of Fireworks (lodged on 15 November 1999) Fergus Ewing*
S1M-284 Dangers of Fireworks (lodged on 15 November 1999) Cathy Jamieson*

S1M-284 Rhoda Grant: Dangers of Fireworks—That the Parliament notes the unsafe and aggressive use of fireworks by children, young people and adults; congratulates Inverness Family Project for its work in highlighting the dangers of fireworks; urges further action to reduce the dangers and problems of fireworks, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to set up a working party to examine the issue. Supported by: Elaine Smith, Fergus Ewing, Cathy Jamieson, Cathy Peattie*

S1M-284 Rhoda Grant: Dangers of Fireworks—That the Parliament notes the unsafe and aggressive use of fireworks by children, young people and adults; congratulates Inverness Family Project for its work in highlighting the dangers of fireworks; urges further action to reduce the dangers and problems of fireworks, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to set up a working party to examine the issue. Supported by: Elaine Smith, Fergus Ewing, Cathy Jamieson, Cathy Peattie
S1M-284 Dangers of Fireworks (lodged on 15 November 1999) Fiona McLeod*, Malcolm Chisholm*

S1M-284 Rhoda Grant: Dangers of Fireworks—That the Parliament notes the unsafe and aggressive use of fireworks by children, young people and adults; congratulates Inverness Family Project for its work in highlighting the dangers of fireworks; urges further action to reduce the dangers and problems of fireworks, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to set up a working party to examine the issue. Supported by: Elaine Smith, Fergus Ewing, Cathy Jamieson, Cathy Peattie, Fiona McLeod, Malcolm Chisholm, Cathie Craigie*, Kate Maclean*
S1M-284 Dangers of Fireworks (lodged on 15 November 1999) Margaret Jamieson*, Janis Hughes*

S1M-284 Rhoda Grant: Dangers of Fireworks—That the Parliament notes the unsafe and aggressive use of fireworks by children, young people and adults; congratulates Inverness Family Project for its work in highlighting the dangers of fireworks; urges further action to reduce the dangers and problems of fireworks, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to set up a working party to examine the issue. Supported by: Elaine Smith, Fergus Ewing, Cathy Jamieson, Cathy Peattie, Fiona McLeod, Malcolm Chisholm, Cathie Craigie, Kate Maclean, Margaret Jamieson, Janis Hughes

S1M-284 Rhoda Grant: Dangers of Fireworks—That the Parliament notes the unsafe and aggressive use of fireworks by children, young people and adults; congratulates Inverness Family Project for its work in highlighting the dangers of fireworks; urges further action to reduce the dangers and problems of fireworks, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to set up a working party to examine the issue. Supported by: Elaine Smith, Fergus Ewing, Cathy Jamieson, Cathy Peattie, Fiona McLeod, Malcolm Chisholm, Cathie Craigie, Kate Maclean, Margaret Jamieson, Janis Hughes
S1M-284 Dangers of Fireworks (lodged on 15 November 1999) Maureen Macmillan*

S1M-284 Rhoda Grant: Dangers of Fireworks—That the Parliament notes the unsafe and aggressive use of fireworks by children, young people and adults; congratulates Inverness Family Project for its work in highlighting the dangers of fireworks; urges further action to reduce the dangers and problems of fireworks, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to set up a working party to examine the issue. Supported by: Elaine Smith, Fergus Ewing, Cathy Jamieson, Cathy Peattie, Fiona McLeod, Malcolm Chisholm, Cathie Craigie, Kate Maclean, Margaret Jamieson, Janis Hughes, Maureen Macmillan, Karen Gillon*
